newsitem.title: USA: Bristol-Myers adds to sales force.
newsitem.headline: Bristol-Myers adds to sales force.

text.p: Bristol-Myers Squibb Co said on Wednesday it plans to further expand its worldwide pharmaceutical sales force, adding 1,200 representatives and managers by early 1997.
By early next year, the company plans to add 720 sales representatives and managers to the U.S. sales force, which would bring the U.S. total to 3,000.
The company will add 500 people to its international sales force by early 1997. A spokesman was unable to provide details on the total size of the worldwide sales force after the additions.
The new sale staff is in addition to 370 sales representatives and managers brought on by Bristol-Myers in the United States in the first half of 1997.

The new sales staff will support two pending cardiovascular drug launches and will back existing products, including Pravachol, Glucophage and Monopril, Bristol-Myers said. The new drugs are the anti-clotting drug clopidogrel and irbesartan for high blood pressure, both licensed from Sanofi SA.
